title: Add some way to keep an original name of a dependency jar when it is placed in `target/lib` directory

labels.name: triage/wontfix
labels.description: This will not be worked on

body:
### Description

When using `legacy-jar` type, Quarkus renames a dependency jar with `<groupName>.<fileName>` format when placing it in `target/lib` directory.
https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/2.7.5.Final/core/deployment/src/main/java/io/quarkus/deployment/pkg/steps/JarResultBuildStep.java#L907

Since some libraries is not designed to be renamed, there should be some workaround.
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/65003590/quarkus-and-provided-dependencies-sapjco3-jar

### Implementation ideas

- Add an option to keep original file name
- Add an option to add an external directory to classpath
